title.narrative: MONITORING CHILDREN RIGHTS AND EVIDENCEGENERATION

description.narrative: The Government has increased capacity to monitor child rights and to generate disaggregated child-related data and evidence, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Early Childhood Development, Evaluation And Research, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children, particularly those in situations of disadvantage, benefit from coordinated policies and programmes, have increased access to integrated social services, and have their rights increasingly monitored.

participating-org.narrative: DEFENSORIA DE LOS DERECHOS DE LA NI

sector.narrative: Administrative data, registers and non-MICS household surveys and censuses
Cash Transfers - social protection data management (management information system, social and beneficiary registries, M&E systems)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The Government has increased capacity to monitor child rights and to generate disaggregated child-related data and evidence

description.narrative: UNICEF Chile continued to contribute to strengthen the Government's capacity in the evidence generation, by strengthening data analysis of national surveys and administrative data, toward the closing information gaps in the country. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2020

title.narrative: # of decision makers and program implementers whose capacities to make children data-based decisions are strengthened.

target.value: 2022:At least three public institutions strengthened to make children data-based decisions.

title.narrative: Existence of a management mechanism for the measurement, monitoring and evaluation of investment on childhood.

target.value: 2022:At least of 2 reports on public investment in childhood.

title.narrative: # of analytical reports based on the measurement of multidimensional child poverty.

target.value: 2022:At least two reports with updated data.

title.narrative: Existence of an institutionalized rights monitoring system.

baseline.value: There is a limited rights monitoring system.

target.value: 2022:There is an institutionalized rights monitoring system covering all rights.

actual.value: 2019:There is a rights monitoring system published by the MDSF (called “Creciendo con Derechos”) covering the priority indicators for children.
